FMECA.Description: Insufficient voltage. Drone lands prematurely and is unable to return to base.
Violation of minimum separation distance. Drone crashes into another drone.
Inaccurate physical GPS. Physical drone fails to maintain accurate GPS positioning
Inaccurate virtual GPS. Virtual drone simulator fails to maintain accurate GPS positioning
Incorrect diversion algorithm. Algorithm for guiding drones through congested airspace directs a drone into the path of another drone.
Excessive drones in airspace. Algorithms not designed to maintain safety for so many drones. Accidents result.
Physical component in drone fails during flight. Drone lands prematurely and/or crashes into other drones.
Power indicator reports incorrect voltage. Drone fails to return to base and runs out of power.
Physical drones are orphaned when mode is changed to virtual. Physical drones are no longer under control.
Communication failure between drone and central command. Physical drone fails to communicate critical status information
Communication failure between central command and drone. Physical drone failes to receive message from ground control
Drone position is outside of flight zone. One or more flight plan waypoints fall outside the flight zone
Drone lands on another drone. Landing sites are accidentally assigned the same coordinates and one drone lands on top of another one.
Suicidal platoon leader. Platoon leader deliberately causes a crash into its own platoon
Communication failure between drones in platoon. A tailing drone does not receive coordinates from its leader
